title: Motsi Mabuse explains reaction to Catherine Tyldesley’s Strictly exit
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Motsi Mabuse has explained her reaction to Catherin Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe being voted off Strictly Come Dancing in favour of Mike Bushell and Katya Jones.

Fans clocked that the newest judge couldn’t hide her annoyance at the result of the show, which saw Catherine being eliminated, but Motsi explained she was ‘sad’ to see the pair of them go after they had worked so hard.

She told Metro.co.uk at the Pride of Britain Awards red carpet what she thought of the surprise result: ‘Well, I mean it’s not such a shock result, it’s just a decision that’s been taken and you saw the ranking list, so it’s part of the game.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I mean everybody knows what they’re signing up for, you know? And I just think the people are disappointed in themselves and they would have liked to do better but this is how it works.’

She added that she couldn’t hide her feelings about Johannes and Catherine’s exit: ‘Well, I was sad, I was sad because I see Johannes [Radebe], he’s a young man from South Africa, I see what he’s achieved, I loved what he did last week.

‘I see those two, they’re so close together and just seeing their sadness, it comes to you and you just let it out.’

Following the shock result, Mike also opened up about the trolling ad hateful messages he had received after being saved to dance another day.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

He told BBC Breakfast: ‘It’s an entertainment show, we’re all trying our best, you’re not really competing against anybody else, you compete against yourself to try and learn to get better and better each week, even if it’s just learning a couple of new steps.

Catherine and Johannes were voted off on Sunday’s show (Picture: BBC)

Motsi couldn’t hide her disappointment at the result (Picture; BBC)

‘As a non-dancer all I can do is put the hours in, do my best and get through it. You have to rise above the abuse on social media, that’s one of the sad things about social media.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘All you can do is do your best, accept the judges’ decision and move on. Johannes and Catherine are lovely people, I didn’t want to see them go but someone has to go.

‘It’s like football – you have to accept the referee’s decision. [The judges] are the best judges in the world, they do know what they’re talking about, if they’d sent me home that would have been the best decision, I can’t get involved in any of that.

‘I just have to concentrate on improving, and if Katya is happy with what I’m doing then I’m happy.’

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.

description: Motsi Mabuse revealed why she appeared 'livid' after Mike Bushell was saved over Catherine Tyldesley in last weekend's show.
